name.conventional_long_form: Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka

government.legislative_power: Exercised by a Parliament elected by universal franchise on a proportional representation basis
government.executive_power: Exercised by a President elected by the people, including defense

presidents.name: William Gopallawa
presidents.notes: First President of Sri Lanka (formerly Ceylon). Served in a ceremonial role.

presidents.name: Junius Richard Jayewardene
presidents.notes: Introduced the Executive Presidency in 1978, and assumed the position of president of Sri Lanka.

presidents.name: Ranasinghe Premadasa
presidents.notes: Assassinated during a May Day rally by an LTTE suicide bomber.

presidents.name: Dingiri Banda Wijetunga
presidents.notes: Prime Minister at the time of Premadasa's assassination. Appointed as acting president and continued in that capacity until 7 May 1993 when he was elected by Parliament to the office of president under Article 40 of the Constitution.

presidents.name: Chandrika Kumaratunga
presidents.notes: The first non-UNP president of the country.

presidents.name: Mahinda Rajapaksa
presidents.notes: Ended the 25-year-long Sri Lankan Civil War and LTTE insurgency in the country. Introduced the 18th Amendment to the Constitution, impeached Shirani Bandaranayake.

presidents.name: Maithripala Sirisena
presidents.notes: Ran as a candidate of the New Democratic Front and was mainly backed by the UNP. 19th Amendment to the Constitution.

presidents.name: Gotabaya Rajapaksa
presidents.notes: Amassed extensive presidential powers through the 20th Amendment to the Constitution. Economic mismanagement led the country to an economic crisis, and a subsequent political crisis, when he refused to resign in response to massive anti-government protests.

presidents.name: Ranil Wickremesinghe
presidents.notes: Appointed as acting president following the resignation of Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who fled the country amidst the 2022 Sri Lankan political crisis. On 20 July 2022 he was elected by Parliament to the office of president under Article 40 of the Constitution.

presidents.name: Anura Kumara Dissanayake
presidents.notes: Defeated Sajith Premadasa and Ranil Wickremesinghe in a three-way contest.

industries: Metal, dye & mold machinery tools & allied industries
Granite, tile, pottery, ceramics & building related industries
Inks, chemicals, printing materials & allied industries

visa_information: Consult your local Sri Lanka embassy, consulate, tourist office, or your travel agent.

business_hours.banks: 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. or 3:00 p.m., Monday to Saturday

flag.name: Lion Flag
flag.description: Features a golden lion holding a sword on a maroon background, with four bo leaves in each corner and two vertical stripes in green and orange.

emblem.name: National Emblem of Sri Lanka
emblem.description: A blue-bordered gold circle featuring a lion holding a sword, surrounded by a lotus flower design and traditional motifs.

gem.name: Blue Sapphire
gem.description: A precious gemstone commonly found in Sri Lanka, symbolizing wisdom and royalty.

national_sport.name: Volleyball
national_sport.description: Volleyball was officially declared the national sport of Sri Lanka in 1991, although cricket remains the most popular sport in the country.
